com.worldpay.numbers.n2w

Interface ILimitedNumberToWord

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DivisibleNumberToWord, HundredToWord, MillionToWord, NumberToWord, TenToWord, ThousandToWord, UnitToWord, ZeroToWord

    public interface ILimitedNumberToWord
    ILimitedNumberToWord an interface intended to add some limits checking feature to a NumberToWord class. A n number which is intended to be converted to words is considered within limits if n is greater or equal to a given floor (the lower limit) and lower or equal to a given ceiling (the upper limit).
    Author:
    Guilherme Cassolato, guilherme.cassolato@worldpay.com

      • withinLowerLimit

        boolean withinLowerLimit()
        Checks whether the number is within the lower limit
        Returns:
        true if the number is greater or equal to the lower limit specified by the instance class; false otherwise.

      • withinUpperLimit

        boolean withinUpperLimit()
        Checks whether the number is within the upper limit
        Returns:
        true if the number is lower or equal to the upper limit specified by the instance class; false otherwise.

      • withinLimits

        boolean withinLimits()
        Checks whether the number is within the both limits (lower and upper)
        Returns:
        true if the number is within both limits (lower inclusive and upper inclusive) specified by the instance class; false otherwise.
